articles.title: Lionel Messi Turns 35: Here are Argentine Football Legend's Records Proving he is the 'GOAT'
articles.description: HAPPY BIRTHDAY LIONEL MESSI: Argentina talisman Lionel Messi celebrates his 35th birthday on June 24. The iconic footballer moved to the French club Paris Saint Germain from Barcelona in the summer of 2021. For many, Messi is the greatest footballer in the history of the sport. He is famous for his innate dribbling, vision, passing capacity, and goal-scoring prowess.

articles.title: Shakira Earns First No. 1 on Billboard Argentina Hot 100
articles.description: Plus, late Argentine cumbia singer El Noba, takes the Greatest Gainer honor thanks to “El Trucho,” with Perro Primo, Al Records, featuring. DT.Bilardo.
articles.content: Shakira scores her first No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart as “Te Felicito,” with Rauw Alejandro, lifts 2-1 on the June 18-dated ranking. The track trades places with TINI’s “La Triple T,” through a 1-2 dip, after its fifth consecutive w... [2609 chars]

articles.title: Dozens of Lovable Sausage Dogs Rescued From Cruel Puppy Farm
articles.description: Cops in Argentina rescued dozens of mistreated dachshunds kept crowded together at an illegal puppy farm.
articles.content:
Cops in Argentina rescued dozens of mistreated dachshunds kept crowded together at an illegal puppy farm.

articles.title: VNL: Urnaut, Mozic lift Slovenia to highly-emotional win over Argentina
articles.description: It was an intense battle between Slovenia and Argentina that saw red cards given to both Argentinian libero Santiago Danani and Slovenian outside hitter Rok Mozic
articles.content:
Slovenia bounced back with a huge win over Argentina in a highly-intense four-set game, 25-20, 27-29, 25-18, 25-17, to pocket its third win in the 2022 FIVB Volleyball Nations League, Thursday evening at the SMART Araneta Coliseum in Quezon City.

articles.title: Diego Maradona: Eight doctors and nurses who cared for Argentina legend face homicide charges after his death
articles.description: Diego Maradona died in 2020 at the age of 60 due to a cardiac arrest; prosecutors claim the Argentina legends death came as a result of omissions by doctors, nurses and a psychologist; eight medical staff charged with simple homicide, which carries a sentence of up to 25 years

articles.title: Diego Maradona: eight to go on trial in Argentina for homicide
articles.description: Defendants named in judge’s report include football star’s three doctors, a psychiatrist and two nurses
articles.content:
Eight people who took care of the Argentinian football superstar Diego Maradona will be tried for homicide, according to a ruling released on Wednesday following an investigation into his death from cardiac arrest.

articles.title: Medical Staff in Argentina to be Tried for Diego Maradona's Death
articles.description: Eight medical personnel will stand trial for alleged criminal neglect causing Argentine football legend Diego Maradona to die in bed while receiving post-surgery care
articles.content:
Eight medical personnel will stand trial for alleged criminal neglect causing Argentine football legend Diego Maradona to die in bed while receiving post-surgery care.
